Fields.DialogueText: Khamsa... arba'a... thalaatha...
A word, Nubian?
Son of a– Qubtan! How long have you been standing there?
How long have you been lying there?
Not quite long enough.
The crew said you've been there for some time. I'll confess to having been a little worried.
Ever watchful... admirable in a hunter. You will appreciate my exercise, then.
Exercise? You looked like you were just lying down.
Would that I had camouflage to look like the deck... No, Qubtan, I am practicing patience. Lie here on the prow, rifle at the ready, count to a thousand...
Until you sense an enemy?
Until I sense an enemy. The sea is full of noise, and I must do my best to tune it out.

Fields.MenuText: You can't do this in your quarters?
What if you don't find an enemy?
This looks suspiciously like sleeping.

Fields.DialogueText: Too peaceful. I need outdoor chaos to set myself against.
I try again the next day. That is the advantage of hunting for sport and not for food.
So does prayer, yet both are manna for the spirit.
You happened to catch me right before I finished counting. I suppose I must start again...
That won't be necessary. The Morganas should be within firing distance in minutes.
Then I am well rested from my nap!
I thought you were practicing?
Perspective, Qubtan. Lionesses sleep eighteen hours a day!
@BATTLE
Ah, here you are.
Hello, Nubian! Having a good day?
Smell that air, Qubtan! It was time for a change of scenery, was it not?

Fields.MenuText: From sea to... more sea. Got it.
Heh. "Sea-nery."
You're adapting well.

Fields.DialogueText: There is more to the sea than the water, you know!
All due respect, Qubtan, you are lucky you outrank me.
Master the environment before you master its creatures.
I'm sure you've read the dispatches from Command, then.
Violence reported against civilian vessels. Simply reprehensible!
It's war, after all. Civilians can come under fire if they contribute materially to the war effort.
And often if they don't. Rest assured, Qubtan. I deal in force, but not in terror.
At least Morganas don't have civilians.
What good fortune for our souls, even if theirs are damned.
Morganas on our starboard side.
Some of the villains terrorizing the people of this region?
Not according to the dispatches, but I'm sure we'll find them soon enough.
Pah! Find me real targets.
@BATTLE
Nubian, come read this.
More information from Command?
From local radio stations. I've asked around for communication records from right before recent disappearances and attacks.
You have picked up the trail! Where does it lead?
Nearly all of the vessels reporting to the coast guard reported heading to some safe haven offshore.
Hmm... that seems suspect, Qubtan. Offshore is no safe haven for anyone these days.
That's what they kept telling the civilians, but every exchange ended shortly after mentioning the safe haven. And none of the victims returned.
Do you believe the broadcast is Morgana in origin?

Fields.MenuText: No way of knowing, but I'd bet you anything it is.
We can't be certain. We shouldn't act until we know everything.
What if it isn't?

Fields.DialogueText: Alshayatin... is there nothing they won't stoop to?
And let these scavengers grow fat in their lairs? I won't allow it!
Then we deal with an even darker evil.
Civilian ships are no threat to Morganas. Why bother with deceit?
War is deceit, Qubtan. But peace be upon him, the Prophet forbade treachery. That is exactly what a false safe haven is.
Looks like our conscience is clear.
Only if we take the fight to these witches.
Let's start here.
"Thou shalt not hear, thou shalt behold my reply..."
@BATTLE
Fighting again?
Fighting again. Come at me, if you dare!
I think I'll pass.
Oh, come now, Qubtan! The crew is here to learn. They deserve only the finest display of skill!

Fields.MenuText: Hand to hand combat isn't really part of my duties.
You asked for it. Don't hold back.
Aren't you supposed to be solving our little safe haven mystery?

Fields.DialogueText: Kalam farighan! We did our duty when we bagged this morning's kill.
Observe the strange prey, my friends... it invites the predator to strike!
Aren't you?
All right, let's do this. What are the rules?
What rules?
Whoa!
How intimately you acquaint yourself with my deck... if I didn't know better, I'd think you up to something scandalous!
My shoulder's feeling kind of scandalous right now.
Nothing you cannot walk off.
Your confidence in my health is noted.
It is also sincere!
@BATTLE
Qubtan, anzur hunak! Do you see that sailboat over there?
Good eye, Nubian! What could it possibly be doing out here?
Right now, it is bait. Here come the Morganas now!
I suppose we should be thankful we didn't have to lay the trap ourselves.
I will not celebrate the endangerment of these civilians. When the trap is sprung and the bait retrieved uneaten, then we may rest easy.
Uneaten...
Do not worry. These are not that kind of Morganas.
@BATTLE
Did we manage to save everyone aboard?
Thank God, we did. They would only have assisted the Morganas had they been captured.
We'll get the survivors to shore. Any cargo we need to know about?
They tell me they threw it overboard to effect a quicker escape. Their manifest survives, though... coded.
Coded?
Perhaps they did not want the Morganas reading it.

Fields.MenuText: I don't trust that. It's not cargo the Morganas are after.
What could they have that the Morganas could possibly want?
Can you read it?

Fields.DialogueText: They are scavengers by nature. Perhaps they sought repairs.
I still struggle to understand these terrors.
Not yet.
Let me know when you've got that decoded. It should at least teach us about their hunting patterns.
Na'am sayidi.
Qubtan? Qubtan, antabah!
Calm down, Nubian. What's got you so worked up?
Did we take down the identities of the survivors we rescued, Qubtan?
They'll be in our logs. Why?
Aljahim! They'd be useless anyway. They've already disembarked!
Nubian, what are you talking about? Is it something to do with the logs?
I have decoded them. You will not like what I found.
That's going to have to wait. Morganas incoming!
@BATTLE
You're kidding.
I wish my sense of humor were so black. The manifests contained many of the same items reported missing from all those civilian vessels.
The ones lured to the false safe haven.
Pirates, Qubtan. In my opinion, they are worse than Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure I would go that far.
You're not just angry they slipped one by you?
But why would they put themselves at risk?

Fields.DialogueText: At least the Morganas do not prey on their sisters.
"No one who has an atom's weight of pride in his heart will enter the Garden." This is not about me, Qubtan.
As long as there is fear, there are jackals to prey on it.
We saved the people we were trying to bring to justice in the first place.
Like a lioness crippling prey for the hyenas.
Where are you going?
To apologize to God.
Yawm jayid lak, Qubtan.
Good to see you. Have you finished apologizing to God?
For now.
What does he say?
"Help your brother, wronging or wronged."
I suppose that's what we did, even if those survivors were pirates.
The Prophet, peace and blessings upon him, went on to say, "You can restrain him from injustice. That is helping him."
You don't have to blame yourself for what we did. For what they might or might not end up doing.
I may be able to accept that eventually, Qubtan. I cannot help feeling responsible nonetheless. Are we not sworn to fight for those who cannot?
So a few pirates take advantage of our charity. That doesn't mean we stop helping those in need.
We simply create more in need of help.
We'll be there for them. Your sisters will, too.
All fifteen of them.
And all of the Belles, whether they like it or not.
Heh... some of their motives are not so pure as yours or mine, you know. I know of some Soviet Belles with their sights set on our allies, once all is said and done.

Fields.MenuText: That's tomorrow's war. For now, we all fight today's.
See? You're already on the right track.
They're that open about it?

Fields.DialogueText: We fight it together, for better and for worse.
I need no comparison with Communists to feel better about my actions.
If you must compliment those girls, you can at least call them honest.
Half of winning a war is winning the peace, Qubtan. It is one battle that you pray never ends.
So is helping those in need.
I believe we are called on to do so once more. Hunt with me?
Lead the way.
@BATTLE
Distressing news, Qubtan!
It must be, to shake you out of your nap.
Oh, asmat. Civilians again, Qubtan, and lured to the same safe haven as before.
Meaning a Morgana ambush.
It just does not make sense... how could anyone fall for the ruse again? Was it not made public?
Command is wary about what they present as fact. The Morganas don't like to stick to just one tactic.
It is as you said, Qubtan – a never-ending battle! Why not arm our most vulnerable?

Fields.MenuText: I'll see what I can get Command to agree to. Maybe they'll make some announcements.
We can't risk making the Morganas more unpredictable than they already are.
What would you have us do?

Fields.DialogueText: Do please, Qubtan. We cannot be the only ones who have seen such treachery.
Madha? Your prey is either unpredictable or it is not. There is no middle ground!
Spread the word, Qubtan. Play it safe. They must know the Morganas have learned to manipulate our desire to go home.
We'll both draw something up and run it by Command. You've been more than an asset before, Nubian. They trust you.
Shukraan jazila. It is not enough to react. We must seek to prevent.
Then you'll enjoy this next battle. We're about to get the drop on our enemy.
Surprise is a rare gift. I will exploit it to the fullest!
@BATTLE
Damn! That's that, then.
Have you received Command's reply?
They've only denied advertising a safe haven. They're not committing to a counter-broadcast until a vote at the next session.
Bureaucrats.
Someone's got to stay home and keep the records.
It sounds like what Command needs is a little proof of concept.
You're suggesting we do something ourselves?
We Belles are friendly faces on unfeeling war machines. Why not be a little friendlier? Embolden the rest of the pack, as it were.

Fields.MenuText: That might attract Morgana attention we don't want.
Excellent idea. Get me a transcript and I'll get it on the air.
You're not worried about going over Command's head?

Fields.DialogueText: I could always start keeping trophies aboard again.
You will have it by the next sunset!
Not at all. We were a pleasant surprise when we appeared, and I intend to stay that way!
I'll find someone with a good speaking voice to read what you write for me.
With respect, Qubtan... I would prefer to read it myself.
Of course. Why is that?
We Belles are more than just ships. We speak with human voices. It is only right that we offer human comfort.
Just don't wear out your voice now. It looks like we're headed for trouble.
This one deserves a battle cry anyway.
@BATTLE
Now?
Whenever you're ready.
Ahem... As-salaamu alaykum! I am the HMS Nubian of His Majesty's Royal Navy.
You may have heard broadcasts of a safe haven on islands offshore. Do not believe them! We have apprehended pirates using this lie to attract prey.
For now, you are advised to remain far from the open ocean, the better to avoid Morgana attacks. I am a Belle, and my sisters and I are sworn to protect you.
... That is all. Ma? al-sal?mah!
Nervous?
Me? The great huntress Nubian, nervous? Whatever would give you that idea?
You're shaking. It's actually starting to rock the ship a little.
Ya lahwi! Forgive me, Qubtan.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry. You did great!

Fields.DialogueText: I am used to letting my hunter's prowess speak for itself. Public speaking is... novel.
That went out on all channels. It ought to give people a little guidance.
All channels, Qubtan?
As far as I'm aware.
Then the Morganas will have heard! What if they are driven to step up their incursions?
All the more reason to be everywhere at once.
I do so enjoy having a goal. Let us start here.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Broadcasting to everybody? It gets easier the more you do it.
Was that stage fright? Wow.

Fields.DialogueText: I may not want that opportunity, Qubtan.
That comment will not be repeated to the crew or any to other being, Qubtan.
Did I?
Dispatch from Command.
Doubtless to congratulate us on our proactive broadcast!
You're half right. They're taking a serious look at fishing communities here on the Moroccan coast of the North Atlantic.
As we had hoped! What is the other half?
They're taking a very serious look. Full inquiry and recommendation expected within weeks. Until then, we're expected to return to our normal duties.
You mean, we cannot continue to speak to the people we defend?

Fields.MenuText: It's just a strong recommendation.
We've done our part. It's Command's responsibility now.
We don't even know the full extent of the broadcast's effect.

Fields.DialogueText: Then it may be discarded. I will not relinquish my stewardship over these human lives, Qubtan.
It is still our responsibility. At best, Command share in it.
It's got to be better than nothing!
I'm not suggesting we stop helping people entirely. We have Command's attention. Now we hold it.
Ours is a difficult task, Qubtan, but one too great to simply hand off.
Let's focus on the task at hand.
This group. here! Their colors will make a fine trophy!
@BATTLE
Good news, Nubian!
A response from Command?
More than a response. Read this.
"Avoiding Morganas" ...

Fields.MenuText: Command needs new copywriters, don't they?
It's being distributed up and down the coasts. That ought to mitigate the attacks.
This is only a test run. They'll monitor its effectiveness carefully.

Fields.DialogueText: The title is a touch unwieldy, but it gets the point across.
At long last! Even we Belles cannot be everywhere at once.
Even so, it is a step in the right direction.
They quote you directly in the section on Morgana radio.
An honor! I am glad to see my words used beyond our limited scope.
I wouldn't call it limited.
Any hunter has a keen sense of scarcity. Our resources may be finite, but that is why we wait for the proper hunting environment.
Or create it ourselves.
Oh, for a little control over the weather now and again...
Well, we will make do with what we have. Morganas incoming!
@BATTLE
A near miss! Hawal thaniat, sailor.
Always something different with you, isn't it?
Ah, Qubtan! Won't you stay for the demonstration?
I wasn't aware of one.
I must have neglected to mention it. Sailor, show him!
Where did she get a bow?
I whittled one for her just last night! Planks and hemp are deadly in the proper hands.
We're at sea. What's the target?
Me, of course! Ha!
Impressive dodge. Can I ask why?
A bit of selfishness turned into a morale exercise. It does the crew some good to see superhuman feats on their side!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not interrupting anything, am I?
Morganas are a little more technologically advanced than that.
Looks more like a circus act to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Not really, although you may wish to back away. Our sailor is not an expert shot yet...
You would be surprised, Qubtan. Some of them have a flair for the classics.
Call it what you will. My reflexes, like my claws, must stay sharp!
Ha! Caught one! For you, Qubtan.
Thank you for the arrow... I think.
Put it on your wall. This is one trophy the Morganas will not seek out. Consider it a reminder that I am watching over you.
Appreciated. Keep watching... We're supposed to encounter the enemy any moment now.
Lesson over, sailor! Go find someone a bit stronger.
@BATTLE
(an arrow fires... and misses Nubian)
Nubian, Command's sent me the latest Moroccan dispatches. You might be interested.
Dayima, Qubtan! Hmm...
They're reporting a steep drop in civilian casualties in-
"... in all areas observing recommended steps." What does this mean?
Everywhere that's taking Command's measures has reported...
Are there some that are not?
Those in the control group have experienced similar casualties to before the release of the guide, yes.
Control group? Qubtan, Command is playing with lives here!

Fields.MenuText: I don't like it any more than you do, but Command insisted.
We can't change more than one variable at a time.
We're in the middle of a war. Life is a resource like any other.

Fields.DialogueText: Then we must insist back. We did it before and we can do it again.
Variable? If there is the slightest chance this will save lives, we mustn't withhold it!
Life is precious, Qubtan. Every creature seems to know this except humans.
This isn't the end. As far as I'm concerned, Command's given us a list.
Agreed. Anywhere they have not deigned to aid, there we will be.
You said we should seek to prevent. This is our chance.
Starting with them...
@BATTLE
Another strong recommendation from Command.
Yes, I've read it already. That is all it amounts to.
We're operating within our jurisdiction. I don't see the problem.
There isn't one. Someone at Command wishes to claim credit for saving the people that only we can save.
Have you tracked the Morganas in this area?
Based on their patterns of attack in recent weeks, they should be showing up here at any... ah, yes.
Action stations. Let's show them we can be everywhere at once.
@BATTLE
Gone. We have liberated another stretch of coast this day, Qubtan!
Well done. Command's going to like this.
Grudgingly. I appreciate human cooperation, but at times your kind can desire glory too much and accountability too little.

Fields.MenuText: I've heard of some Belles like that, too.

Fields.DialogueText: Alas, we all have our black sheep.
Look, we'll have to pretend to be glory-seekers for a little while, as far as Command is concerned.
They have their results. I invite them to study ours.

Fields.MenuText: I hope you're not making eyes at me when you say that.
But we're capable of wonderful things, too.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh? Maybe I was making eyes for another reason...
That might be nice!
I would never deny that some are quite amazing creatures, Qubtan. Some of my favorite people are... people.
Huh?
Full speed ahead, Qubtan! The safe haven is close at hand!
By which you mean the Morgana ambush.
Min almwsf alqawl, yes. How words do change...
@BATTLE
Good news. Command isn't shutting us down.
Of course they aren't! We have bagged too much prey for them to hamstring us.
There's a downside. They're going to be holding you personally responsible for any setbacks in our defense actions.
Me, Qubtan? Not you? Not the crew?

Fields.MenuText: I signed off on your request. The least I can do is accept responsibility.
It was your idea to begin with.
It doesn't make any sense to me either, but that's what they're saying.

Fields.DialogueText: No need, Qubtan. You can tell them I coerced you, for all I care.
I am proud to say so!
It makes perfect sense to me.
As far as I am concerned, Command's assessment of the situation is nothing I do not already do.
You can't save everyone, Nubian. There's no need to shoulder that kind of burden.
"A hopeful sinner is closer to the mercy of God than a hopeless worshipper."
I wouldn't call Command hopeless.
I have not given up on protecting this world and all of its people. I know in my heart that neither have you.
Coming from you, that's a high compliment.
The very highest, for it demands fulfillment.
Action stations, Nubian! We can't let them get away.
Never fear, Qubtan! They will be sent limping back to their lairs!
Sounds like a plan.
@BATTLE
That's the last of them.
Indeed, though our work has only begun.
We've still got time before we have to return to base. What did you have in mind?
I thought we'd make port here for a brief moment.
Nubian, this is just a fishing village. They don't have the resources to service you.
Of course. It is I who must service them.

Fields.MenuText: Driving away the Morganas wasn't enough?

Fields.DialogueText: The foxes are gone, but the henhouse was still ravaged. My personal store of food should be enough to carry them through a few days.
Command allocates that to you.
Yes, and I cannot for the life of me understand why. Belles do not need to eat. Though as a matter of habit, it does allow me to fast from time to time.
I'm proud to be your captain, Nubian.
Simple charity. Think nothing of it.

Fields.MenuText: That's who we're fighting for.
If it's important to you, it's important to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Qubtan.
We have performed wonderful deeds, but our work is not done.
Precisely.
Nubian? Meditating again?
Zzzz...
Nubian!
Qubtan! Are there Morganas nearby?
They could appear at any moment. Are you all right?
I must have fallen asleep. Forgive me... it is not becoming of a huntress.

Fields.MenuText: Just don't let it happen again.
Most huntresses get some sleep now and again.
Sweet dreams?

Fields.DialogueText: 'Ana 'aetadhir. I swear it.
Yes, but usually at night.
Of a peaceful world. There are none sweeter.
It seems like we've been out here nonstop, doesn't it?
A walrus will spend three and a half days awake looking for food.
You're not a walrus.
Thank you, Qubtan, but you know what I mean.
You're working yourself too hard.
The Morganas are deceiving people into thinking there is a safe haven. I must present myself as an alternative! What are we out here for otherwise?
A preemptive strike against the so-called safe haven.
Precisely. Join me in making it?
@BATTLE
This isn't right.
What are you looking at?
Those Morgana broadcasts we've been following... they've gotten further and further from shore. Surely you've noticed.
If there is the slightest possibility anyone might be deceived...
This is getting out of hand. The Morganas are using our vigilance against us.
How do you... Qubtan! That's it!
You see it now, don't you? The pirates were a red herring all along.
Or simply an inspiration. The Morganas cannibalize their prey for repairs. Who's to say they don't do the same with strategies?
Draw us further and further from the coast...
With vague threats against civilians, the better to make good on a real one! Qubtan, we must set sail for Morocco at once!

Fields.MenuText: Let's not be so hasty. This could be another ruse.
Shouldn't we notify Command?
The Morganas have surprised us before. We won't let it happen again.

Fields.DialogueText: The Morganas have deceived us this long, Qubtan. No longer!
That is tantamount to giving up the coast to the Morganas. No, we must act swiftly once more.
They shall not hear, they shall behold my reply.
And here they are now. It's like they know already.
Do not give them too much credit, Qubtan. That is exactly what they want!
@BATTLE
What is your top speed, Nubian?
Around 36 knots. Never fast enough, I fear.
Steady on, Nubian. We may be just in time.
Just in time to run directly into an ambush.
Damn. This was their plan all along, wasn't it?
Now, Qubtan, what did I tell you about giving the Morganas too much credit?
@BATTLE
That should clear us the way to Morocco. Now we may notify Command, if we must.

Fields.MenuText: Already drafting a request. We don't know how big this is going to be.
We've taken on overwhelming odds before.
We're still certain the safe haven ruse was just that?

Fields.DialogueText: Are we ever certain, Qubtan? We must be prepared when the situation turns dire.
I feel that there have been none so overwhelming as these.
Positive. There's a storm coming, Qubtan...
Quiet today, isn't it?
Only compared to the fight we are sailing into.
All you need do is listen, and you will hear so much more.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure I'm hearing what you need me to hear.
The sea? The ship? Or the crew?
I just give the orders.

Fields.DialogueText: A moment's rest, Qubtan. That is all you need, now and again.
Close. The hunter's ear takes time to develop.
And I carry them out... with advice, of course.
It is as I told you not long ago, Qubtan. The sea is full of noise. A hunter must make sense of it. The hum of her engine, the direction of the wind...
You and I look at a battlefield from different perspectives.
Haq, neither of which are necessarily wrong. Communication is the difference between disagreement and compromise.
What happens afterward?
After the battle? Or after the war?
The answers to those questions may be the same.
There will always be more for me to hunt, though my time will come one day. If a little part of me could be taken to Mecca when I am no longer at sea...
I'll see what I can do.
That may not be for a long time.
Hunters are good at waiting.
That they are, Qubtan. That they are.
But now, let us wait no longer.
@BATTLE
They just keep coming, don't they?
Calm yourself, Qubtan. At least your instincts were correct in time.
Our instincts. We made the decision to be here together.
I am a decent enough solitary predator. How refreshing it is to have a mate by my side!
Excuse me?
Oh, my! Forgive the expression. Fath alnnara!
@BATTLE
Is that a retreat or a feint?
The former, if they know what's good for them. That last bombardment would leave nothing of a human enemy.
Finally, it's over.
Nothing is ever over, Qubtan. But perhaps we can turn to the next phase of the war now.
Rebuilding.
Rebuilding. Our perimeter must briefly fall back, but it will be reestablished all the stronger.

Fields.MenuText: With full support from Command, naturally.
Assuming we don't fall for another Morgana trick.
How brief is "briefly"?

Fields.DialogueText: As full as we can expect. Our swiftness will be noted, of that I am sure.
If guile fails us, we can always fall back on brute force.
As brief as we allow it to be.
*ALARM*
Have we received our next assignment from Command?
When we're available. I'm still having some crew coordinate relief efforts for the nearby villages. I haven't heard back from the French.
The protectorate is a show. "In Morocco, there is only one government, the sharifian government..."
... protected by the French.
I do not claim to know the region intimately, but I think it a matter of opinion who rules there. If not, only a matter of time.
The situation on land is out of our hands. We'll do what we can at sea and on the coast.
There again is our greater jihad. We have already appointed ourselves guardians of these people. To remove immediate dangers is only the first step.

Fields.MenuText: Eventually, we're going to be redeployed.
Well, we can't spend all our time running a charity.
"Half of winning a war is winning the peace..."

Fields.DialogueText: Then we'll leave the Moroccan coast in better shape than we found it.
Think of it as maintenance, Qubtan. As I expect the ship to be in top shape, so do we keep the world running. We are all crew.
I am glad you listen to me. You know I will always listen to you.
Looks like they want one more crack at us. You ready?
The hunt resumes...
@BATTLE
Iceland, Qubtan?
From the desert to the glaciers... what fun, Qubtan! Who knows what the Morganas may attempt there?
You don't think they'll try the same trick they tried here?
They are alshayatin, Qubtan, but something tells me they are the capricious sort. They will not use that siren's call of safety unless we forget it.
You never did strike me as the forgetting type.
My memory dates back to before the Prophet, peace be upon him, before Alexander, before even the last days of old Egypt. They will have to be especially clever.

Fields.MenuText: Some of them are cleverer than you think.
How do you keep all that straight in your head?
If only humans could remember that well.

Fields.DialogueText: Every prey species has its bright stars. One way or another, I will snuff them out!
History and humans have patterns, Qubtan. All the more intriguing when you defy them.
Then there would be no conflict... but eventually, no learning. Your kind is a beautiful sort of paradox.
There's going to be a celebration tonight. The crew has been saving their rations for it.
I will pass on most of the festivities, Qubtan! "If thou art a man, avoid wine. How can a rational being endeavor after madness!"
The Quran?
Richard Robert Madden. An Irish visitor to my homelands.
You're as full of contradictions as any human.
I think that brings us closer, don't you?
As does a good fight. Let's say goodbye to the Morganas, shall we?
Bikull surur!
@BATTLE
Iceland. Quite the change of scenery, isn't it?
Another nap?
Qubtan! I was just thinking my day would not be complete without a bit of your usual cheek.
I hope I haven't interrupted your hunter "counting" again.
Iihusn alhaz, la. I have simply been turning over an idea in my head. It came to me at prayers, as God often sees fit to grant such ideas.
What sort of idea?
It has been a while since I made dinner, when I was encouraging the crew to eat properly. Shall I repeat the favor?

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely. I think they'd appreciate that.

Fields.DialogueText: I am glad. Though I had rather thought I would do this for you. For us.
Are you asking what I think you're asking?
The world is full of hunters, Qubtan. Some greater than even I. It is not often that I find one as good at gardening as at killing.
I'm flattered, but we wouldn't be where we are without your drive.
Nor without your perspective. I fancy myself blessed with a long memory. Sometimes it takes a short lifespan to see what's in front of you.
And what do you see?
I wait out here until I see an enemy. Right now my eyes see an ally. A companion. But my heart sees... something closer.
*ALARM*
Trust Morganas to interrupt us.
Curse their blood!
I do have an answer for you, though.
Yes?
It can wait until after the battle.
Hmm... yes, I suppose it can. It would not be the first time I have had to wait.
You're a hunter. You'll know when to strike.
"Thou shalt not hear, thou shalt behold my reply." Be careful what you wish for, Qubtan...
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: What about just making dinner for me? I mean... for us?
Your cooking? Eh, maybe I should take over.

Fields.DialogueText: I serve the crew. Especially the qubtan.
You're joking. Besides, I know you will enjoy what I can serve you.
